title: Brandborg 2016 Love Puppets Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: There's a scent and flavor of leather running through this wine, along with pepper, bitter greens and tightly wound cranberry fruit. The earthy character continues in the tannins, and finishes with residual flavors of astringent green tea.

title: D'Aione 2012  Taurasi
description: This opens with aromas recalling exotic incense, weedy underbrush and camphor. On the dense, one-dimensional palate, grainy but evolved tannins provide fleeting support for fleshy plum and raspberry jam before a short, raspy finish.

title: Fulkerson 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: A sharp nose of crushed limestone, tomato leaf and citrus zest makes for a bracing start. The palate is equally stony and tense in feel, with a plethora of tart citrus flavors.

title: Guerra 2014 De Pura Cepa Roble Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Generic cherry, berry and spice aromas make for a solid nose. This Mencía is fleshy but lacking in depth and intensity. Plum, currant and cherry flavors are diluted on the finish.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2015 Barrel Fermeted Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: An ultraripe nose of melon drizzled with drawn butter and lemon juice starts this off. The palate is broad and fleshy in feel, offering ripe stone fruit and melon flavors that end slightly hot.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2017 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This is a rounded wine, reflecting the warm sun of the Alentejo while not losing all sense of freshness and acidity. It is certainly rich with ripe yellow fruits, mangoes and spice and pepper. It is ready to drink.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2017 Monte Velho Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Full of rich fruit, this open and ripe wine is made to be drunk young. That means the tannins and structure of this blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira, Touriga Nacional and Syrah are full, generous and easy-going. Drink now.

title: Hunt Country Vineyards 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)
description: An aroma of freshly pressed apples and pears greets the nose, with orchard blossoms riding in the background. This is persistent and juicy on the palate, with a rounded red apple flavor balanced by a bright lemony tang.

title: Knights Bridge 2016 East Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: This wine has pretty floral elements that come to fore ahead of a heavier, riper style that's viscous and plush on the palate. Golden-apple flavors take on a baked note, accompanied by pineapple and crème brûlée.

title: Leese-Fitch 2016 Merlot (California)
description: A charred wood aroma and toasted bread flavors stand out in this medium-bodied oaky-flavored wine, masking much of the fruit flavor that might lie beneath.

title: Maiden + Liberty 2016 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Aromas of ripe melon, pollen and limestone carry the fresh, focused nose. This is light in feel on the palate, dominated by citrus and creamy melon flavors, with a zesty wet-stone note from start to finish.

title: Markus Huber 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Weinland Österreich)
description: Confected berry notes on the nose give an impression of candy and signal the easy-drinking nature of this pale pink sparkler. The palate could do with more precision but is fresh and just about dry. Drink soon.

title: Nieto Senetiner 2016 Don Nicanor Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Gaseous aromas of iodine and latex cloud black plum and berry scents. This feels stocky but grabby and obtuse. Limited black fruit flavors are generic and finish hollow despite this Malbec's bold color and weight.

title: Paris-Simoneau 2017 Antoine Simoneau Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This softly textured, fruity wine has crisp apple flavors and an herbal edge. Citrus zestiness combines with tense acidity and a clean, deliciously fruity character. Drink the wine now.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017  Sancerre
description: The pale color follows through to a light wine, smoothly textured and with just a touch of tannin. A small amount of wood aging has added spice to this red-cherry-flavored wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Pestoni Family 2016 1892 Field Blend Red (Lake County)
description: An aroma of freshly sawn oak boards leads to equally spicy and bold flavors that tamp down the moderate plum flavors underneath. The wine is full bodied, moderately tannic and definitely full of oaky spiciness.

title: Pezzi King 2017 Angela's Estate Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from a saignée of Zinfandel, this offers a briary berry-filled character that tastes somewhat diluted on the midpalate. The wine is easygoing and moderate in acidity, going for power over grace.

title: Pierre Chainier 2017 Clos Chapon Demi Sec  (Vouvray)
description: This is an odd style of wine, neither dry nor sweet. It offers hints of honey as well as orange-zest flavors that are currently confused with acidity, tight apple tastes and acidity. Things should coalesce in time leaving a fresh and honeyed wine.

title: Pietradolce 2015 Vigna Sant'Andrea White (Terre Siciliane)
description: Aromas of French oak, butterscotch and coconut carry over to the lean, linear palate along with hints of orange peel and mineral. It doesn't have enough fruit richness to stand up to the oak.

title: Prospect 772 2017 Baby Doll Rosé (California)
description: Almost dark enough in color to be a red wine, this rosé is the antithesis of the pale Provençal-style wines that are in vogue. It shows effusive floral and raspberry aromas, and plum-skin and watermelon flavors on a medium-bodied frame.
